title: Salve Island

properties.name: description
properties.value: An island could originally be found in the middle of the River Salve. It was added with the release of The Dig Site in 2003. It was possibly added as a placeholder to ensure there was terrain on the other side of the river, as otherwise the player would have appeared to be panning for gold in the ocean.

content:
Salve Island was removed after an update.
As the contents of this page no longer exist in Old School RuneScape, this article is preserved for historical purposes.
This topic name is not found in-game.
While the name or title of this topic is not officially recognised in-game, the information contained on this page is still considered to be canon and is based on official sources.
Salve Island
Released9 July 2003 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationRiver Salve
MusicVenture, Natural
Map
Advanced data
Typeisland

An island could originally be found in the middle of the River Salve. It was added with the release of The Dig Site in 2003. It was possibly added as a placeholder to ensure there was terrain on the other side of the river, as otherwise the player would have appeared to be panning for gold in the ocean.

With the release of RuneScape 2, the island was expanded to the east.

The island itself was empty except for some trees and bushes. Eventually, it was removed from the game entirely in a hidden update between July and September 2005.

An '''island''' could originally be found in the middle of the [[River Salve]]. It was added with the release of [[The Dig Site]] in 2003. It was possibly added as a placeholder to ensure there was terrain on the other side of the river, as otherwise the player would have appeared to be panning for gold in the ocean.

With the release of ''RuneScape 2'', the island was expanded to the east.

The island itself was empty except for some trees and bushes. Eventually, it was removed from the game entirely in a hidden update between July and September 2005.
